sentences.en: A jetliner taxied down the runway and took off.
sentences.cn: 喷气式飞机沿跑道滑行,然后起飞.

sentences.en: An aircraft overshot the runway and was severely damaged.
sentences.cn: 一架飞机冲出了跑道，严重受损。

sentences.en: Captain Shelton guided his plane down the runway and took off.
sentences.cn: 谢尔顿机长驾驶飞机沿跑道滑行起飞。

sentences.en: Our plane has lifted off the runway and is now airborne.
sentences.cn: 我们的飞机已经离开跑道,在空中飞行.

sentences.en: The crew finally landed the plane on its belly on the soft part of the runway.
sentences.cn: 机组人员终于使飞机腹部在跑道土质松软的部分着地。

sentences.en: The new runway is a billion-dollar boondoggle.
sentences.cn: 新的机场跑道耗资10亿美元，却没什么大用处。

sentences.en: The pilot overshot the runway and crashed his aircraft.
sentences.cn: 飞行员让飞机滑出跑道,撞毀了飞机.

sentences.en: The plane apparently overshot the runway after landing.
sentences.cn: 飞机看样子在降落后滑出了跑道。

sentences.en: The plane started taxiing down the runway.
sentences.cn: 飞机开始在跑道上滑行。

sentences.en: The plane veered off the runway and careered through the perimeter fence.
sentences.cn: 飞机突然偏离跑道，高速冲过了周围的护栏。

sentences.en: The runway had to be lengthened.
The runway is clear — go ahead and land.
sentences.cn: 跑道畅通无阻，开始着陆吧。

sentences.en: The runway of this airport is undergoing expansion to accommodate large planes.
sentences.cn: 这个机场的跑道正在扩建以适应大型飞机起落.

sentences.en: The wheels of the aircraft kissed the runway.

trans.tran_en: a long specially prepared hard surface like a road on which aircraft land and take off
